conclusion: Identify the relevant physical laws: Faraday's Law of Induction and Lorentz Force.
Determine the magnetic flux through the circular ring as it enters the magnetic field.
Calculate the induced EMF using the rate of change of magnetic flux.
The area of the circular ring is πR².
Relate the rate of change of area to the velocity of the ring.
The ring is moving with velocity v perpendicular to the magnetic field, and ∠aOb = 90°.
Calculate the EMF using the effective length of the wire cutting through the magnetic field.
Determine the potential difference between points a and b as half of the total induced EMF.
The potential difference between points a and b is B · v · R.
